CVE-2008-0005.title: USN-575-1: Apache vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0005.body: It was discovered that mod_proxy_ftp did not force a character set,which could result in browsers becoming vulnerable to cross-sitescripting attacks when processing the output. By default,mod_proxy_ftp is disabled in Ubuntu. (CVE-2008-0005)

CVE-2008-0007.title: USN-618-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0007.body: It was discovered that some device driver fault handlers did notcorrectly verify memory ranges. A local attacker could exploit thisto access sensitive kernel memory, possibly leading to a loss of privacy.(CVE-2008-0007)

CVE-2008-0008.title: USN-573-1: PulseAudio vulnerability
CVE-2008-0008.body: It was discovered that PulseAudio did not properly drop privilegeswhen running as a daemon. Local users may be able to exploit thisand gain privileges. The default Ubuntu configuration is notaffected.

CVE-2008-0016.title: USN-645-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0016.body: Justin Schuh, Tom Cross and Peter Williams discovered errors in the Firefox URL parsing routines. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted hyperlink, an attacker could overflow a stack buffer and execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-0016)

CVE-2008-0016.title: USN-645-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0016.body: Justin Schuh, Tom Cross and Peter Williams discovered errors in theFirefox URL parsing routines. If a user were tricked into opening acrafted hyperlink, an attacker could overflow a stack buffer andexecute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-0016)

CVE-2008-0017.title: USN-667-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0017.body: Justin Schuh discovered a flaw in Firefox's mime-type parsing. If auser were tricked into opening a malicious website, an attacker couldsend a crafted header in the HTTP index response, causing a browsercrash and execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2008-0017)

CVE-2008-0047.title: USN-598-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0047.body: It was discovered that the CUPS administration interface contained a heap-based overflow flaw. A local attacker, and a remote attacker if printersharing is enabled, could send a malicious request and possibly executearbitrary code as the non-root user in Ubuntu 6.06 LTS, 6.10, and 7.04.In Ubuntu 7.10, attackers would be isolated by the AppArmor CUPS profile.(CVE-2008-0047)

CVE-2008-0053.title: USN-598-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0053.body: It was discovered that the hpgl filter in CUPS did not properly validateits input when parsing parameters. If a crafted HP-GL/2 file were printed,an attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code as the non-root userin Ubuntu 6.06 LTS, 6.10, and 7.04. In Ubuntu 7.10, attackers would beisolated by the AppArmor CUPS profile. (CVE-2008-0053)

CVE-2008-0062.title: USN-587-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0062.body: It was discovered that krb5 did not correctly handle certain krb4requests. An unauthenticated remote attacker could exploit this flawby sending a specially crafted traffic, which could expose sensitiveinformation, cause a crash, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-0062,CVE-2008-0063)

CVE-2008-0063.title: USN-587-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0063.body: It was discovered that krb5 did not correctly handle certain krb4requests. An unauthenticated remote attacker could exploit this flawby sending a specially crafted traffic, which could expose sensitiveinformation, cause a crash, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-0062,CVE-2008-0063)

CVE-2008-0073.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0073.body: Alin Rad Pop discovered an array index vulnerability in the SDPparser. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening amalicious RTSP stream, a remote attacker may be able to executearbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.(CVE-2008-0073)

CVE-2008-0166.title: USN-612-1: OpenSSL vulnerability
CVE-2008-0166.body: We consider this an extremely serious vulnerability, and urge allusers to act immediately to secure their systems. (CVE-2008-0166)

CVE-2008-0166.title: USN-612-2: OpenSSH vulnerability
CVE-2008-0166.body: A weakness has been discovered in the random number generator usedby OpenSSL on Debian and Ubuntu systems. As a result of thisweakness, certain encryption keys are much more common than theyshould be, such that an attacker could guess the key through abrute-force attack given minimal knowledge of the system. Thisparticularly affects the use of encryption keys in OpenSSH.This vulnerability only affects operating systems which (likeUbuntu) are based on Debian. However, other systems can beindirectly affected if weak keys are imported into them.We consider this an extremely serious vulnerability, and urge allusers to act immediately to secure their systems.

CVE-2008-0166.title: USN-612-3: OpenVPN vulnerability
CVE-2008-0166.body: A weakness has been discovered in the random number generator usedby OpenSSL on Debian and Ubuntu systems. As a result of thisweakness, certain encryption keys are much more common than theyshould be, such that an attacker could guess the key through abrute-force attack given minimal knowledge of the system. Thisparticularly affects the use of shared encryption keys and SSL/TLScertificates in OpenVPN.This vulnerability only affects operating systems which (likeUbuntu) are based on Debian. However, other systems can beindirectly affected if weak keys are imported into them.We consider this an extremely serious vulnerability, and urge allusers to act immediately to secure their systems.

CVE-2008-0166.title: USN-612-4: ssl-cert vulnerability
CVE-2008-0166.body: We consider this an extremely serious vulnerability, and urge all users to act immediately to secure their systems. (CVE-2008-0166)

CVE-2008-0166.title: USN-612-7: OpenSSH update
CVE-2008-0166.body: USN-612-2 introduced protections for OpenSSH, related to the OpenSSLvulnerabilities addressed by USN-612-1. This update provides thecorresponding updates for OpenSSH in Ubuntu 6.06 LTS. While the OpenSSLin Ubuntu 6.06 is not vulnerable, this update will block weak keysgenerated on systems that may have been affected themselves.Original advisory details:A weakness has been discovered in the random number generator used by OpenSSL on Debian and Ubuntu systems. As a result of this weakness, certain encryption keys are much more common than they should be, such that an attacker could guess the key through a brute-force attack given minimal knowledge of the system. This particularly affects the use of encryption keys in OpenSSH, OpenVPN and SSL certificates.

CVE-2008-0171.title: USN-570-1: boost vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0171.body: Will Drewry and Tavis Ormandy discovered that the boost librarydid not properly perform input validation on regular expressions.An attacker could send a specially crafted regular expression toan application linked against boost and cause a denial of servicevia application crash.

CVE-2008-0172.title: USN-570-1: boost vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0172.body: Will Drewry and Tavis Ormandy discovered that the boost librarydid not properly perform input validation on regular expressions.An attacker could send a specially crafted regular expression toan application linked against boost and cause a denial of servicevia application crash.

CVE-2008-0225.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0225.body: Luigi Auriemma discovered that xine-lib did not properly checkbuffer sizes in the RTSP header-handling code. If xine-lib opened anRTSP stream with crafted SDP attributes, a remote attacker may beable to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2008-0225, CVE-2008-0238)

CVE-2008-0226.title: USN-588-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0226.body: Luigi Auriemma discovered that yaSSL as included in MySQL did notproperly validate its input. A remote attacker could send craftedrequests and cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrarycode. This issue did not affect Ubuntu 6.06 in the default installation.(CVE-2008-0226, CVE-2008-0227)

CVE-2008-0227.title: USN-588-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0227.body: Luigi Auriemma discovered that yaSSL as included in MySQL did notproperly validate its input. A remote attacker could send craftedrequests and cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrarycode. This issue did not affect Ubuntu 6.06 in the default installation.(CVE-2008-0226, CVE-2008-0227)

CVE-2008-0238.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0238.body: Luigi Auriemma discovered that xine-lib did not properly checkbuffer sizes in the RTSP header-handling code. If xine-lib opened anRTSP stream with crafted SDP attributes, a remote attacker may beable to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2008-0225, CVE-2008-0238)

CVE-2008-0302.title: USN-572-1: apt-listchanges vulnerability
CVE-2008-0302.body: Felipe Sateler discovered that apt-listchanges did not use safe paths whenimporting additional Python libraries. A local attacker could exploitthis and execute arbitrary commands as the user running apt-listchanges.

CVE-2008-0304.title: USN-582-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0304.body: It was discovered that Thunderbird did not properly set the size of abuffer when parsing an external-body MIME-type. If a user were to opena specially crafted email, an attacker could cause a denial of servicevia application crash or possibly execute arbitrary code as the user.(CVE-2008-0304)

CVE-2008-0304.title: USN-582-2: Thunderbird regression
CVE-2008-0304.body: It was discovered that Thunderbird did not properly set the size of a buffer when parsing an external-body MIME-type. If a user were to open a specially crafted email, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash or possibly execute arbitrary code as the user. (CVE-2008-0304)

CVE-2008-0320.title: USN-609-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0320.body: Multiple memory overflow flaws were discovered in OpenOffice.org'shandling of Quattro Pro, EMF, and OLE files. If a user were trickedinto opening a specially crafted document, a remote attacker might beable to execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2007-5745,CVE-2007-5746, CVE-2007-5747, CVE-2008-0320)

CVE-2008-0411.title: USN-599-1: Ghostscript vulnerability
CVE-2008-0411.body: Chris Evans discovered that Ghostscript contained a buffer overflow inits color space handling code. If a user or automated system weretricked into opening a crafted Postscript file, an attacker could causea denial of service or execute arbitrary code with privileges of theuser invoking the program. (CVE-2008-0411)

CVE-2008-0412.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0412.body: Various flaws were discovered in the browser and JavaScript engine.By tricking a user into opening a malicious web page, an attackercould execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CVE-2008-0412, CVE-2008-0413)

CVE-2008-0412.title: USN-582-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0412.body: Various flaws were discovered in Thunderbird and its JavaScriptengine. By tricking a user into opening a malicious message, anattacker could execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CVE-2008-0412, CVE-2008-0413)

CVE-2008-0412.title: USN-582-2: Thunderbird regression
CVE-2008-0412.body: Various flaws were discovered in Thunderbird and its JavaScript engine. By tricking a user into opening a malicious message, an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-0412, CVE-2008-0413)

CVE-2008-0413.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0413.body: Various flaws were discovered in the browser and JavaScript engine.By tricking a user into opening a malicious web page, an attackercould execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CVE-2008-0412, CVE-2008-0413)

CVE-2008-0413.body: Various flaws were discovered in Thunderbird and its JavaScriptengine. By tricking a user into opening a malicious message, anattacker could execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CVE-2008-0412, CVE-2008-0413)

CVE-2008-0413.title: USN-582-2: Thunderbird regression
CVE-2008-0413.body: Various flaws were discovered in Thunderbird and its JavaScript engine. By tricking a user into opening a malicious message, an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-0412, CVE-2008-0413)

CVE-2008-0414.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0414.body: Flaws were discovered in the file upload form control. A maliciouswebsite could force arbitrary files from the user's computer to beuploaded without consent. (CVE-2008-0414)

CVE-2008-0415.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0415.body: Various flaws were discovered in the JavaScript engine. By trickinga user into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could escalateprivileges within the browser, perform cross-site scripting attacksand/or execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-0415)

CVE-2008-0415.title: USN-582-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0415.body: Various flaws were discovered in the JavaScript engine. By trickinga user into opening a malicious message, an attacker could escalateprivileges within Thunderbird, perform cross-site scripting attacksand/or execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-0415)

CVE-2008-0415.title: USN-582-2: Thunderbird regression
CVE-2008-0415.body: Various flaws were discovered in the JavaScript engine. By tricking a user into opening a malicious message, an attacker could escalate privileges within Thunderbird, perform cross-site scripting attacks and/or execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-0415)

CVE-2008-0416.title: USN-592-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0416.body: Alexey Proskuryakov, Yosuke Hasegawa and Simon Montagu discovered flawsin Firefox's character encoding handling. If a user were tricked intoopening a malicious web page, an attacker could perform cross-sitescripting attacks. (CVE-2008-0416)

CVE-2008-0417.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0417.body: Justin Dolske discovered a flaw in the password saving mechanism. Bytricking a user into opening a malicious web page, an attacker couldcorrupt the user's stored passwords. (CVE-2008-0417)

CVE-2008-0418.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0418.body: Gerry Eisenhaur discovered that the chrome URI scheme did not properlyguard against directory traversal. Under certain circumstances, anattacker may be able to load files or steal session data. Ubuntu isnot vulnerable in the default installation. (CVE-2008-0418)

CVE-2008-0418.title: USN-582-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0418.body: Gerry Eisenhaur discovered that the chrome URI scheme did not properlyguard against directory traversal. Under certain circumstances, anattacker may be able to load files or steal session data. Ubuntu is notvulnerable in the default installation. (CVE-2008-0418)

CVE-2008-0418.title: USN-582-2: Thunderbird regression
CVE-2008-0418.body: Gerry Eisenhaur discovered that the chrome URI scheme did not properly guard against directory traversal. Under certain circumstances, an attacker may be able to load files or steal session data. Ubuntu is not vulnerable in the default installation. (CVE-2008-0418)

CVE-2008-0419.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0419.body: David Bloom discovered flaws in the way images are treated by thebrowser. A malicious website could exploit this to steal the user'shistory information, crash the browser and/or possibly executearbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-0419)

CVE-2008-0420.title: USN-582-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0420.body: Flaws were discovered in the BMP decoder. By tricking a user intoopening a specially crafted BMP file, an attacker could obtainsensitive information. (CVE-2008-0420)

CVE-2008-0420.title: USN-582-2: Thunderbird regression
CVE-2008-0420.body: Flaws were discovered in the BMP decoder. By tricking a user into opening a specially crafted BMP file, an attacker could obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2008-0420)

CVE-2008-0486.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0486.body: Damian Frizza and Alfredo Ortega discovered that xine-lib did notproperly validate FLAC tags. If a user or automated system weretricked into opening a crafted FLAC file, a remote attacker may beable to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2008-0486)

CVE-2008-0544.title: USN-595-1: SDL_image vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0544.body: David Raulo discovered that SDL_image did not correctly load ILBM images.If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a speciallycrafted ILBM, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code or causea crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-0544)

CVE-2008-0553.title: USN-664-1: Tk vulnerability
CVE-2008-0553.body: It was discovered that Tk could be made to overrun a buffer when loadingcertain images. If a user were tricked into opening a specially craftedGIF image, remote attackers could cause a denial of service or executearbitrary code with user privileges.

CVE-2008-0554.title: USN-665-1: Netpbm vulnerability
CVE-2008-0554.body: It was discovered that Netpbm could be made to overrun a buffer when loadingcertain images. If a user were tricked into opening a specially craftedGIF image, remote attackers could cause a denial of service or executearbitrary code with user privileges.

CVE-2008-0564.title: USN-586-1: mailman vulnerability
CVE-2008-0564.body: Multiple cross-site scripting flaws were discovered in mailman.A malicious list administrator could exploit this to execute arbitraryJavaScript, potentially stealing user credentials.

CVE-2008-0593.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0593.body: Martin Straka discovered flaws in stylesheet handling after a 302redirect. By tricking a user into opening a malicious web page, anattacker could obtain sensitive URL parameters. (CVE-2008-0593)

CVE-2008-0595.title: USN-653-1: D-Bus vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0595.body: Havoc Pennington discovered that the D-Bus daemon did not correctlyvalidate certain security policies. If a local user sent a speciallycrafted D-Bus request, they could bypass security policies that had a"send_interface" defined. (CVE-2008-0595)

CVE-2008-0598.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0598.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the ia32 emulation under 64bit kernels didnot fully clear uninitialized data. A local attacker could read privatekernel memory, leading to a loss of privacy. (CVE-2008-0598)

CVE-2008-0600.title: USN-577-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
CVE-2008-0600.body: Wojciech Purczynski discovered that the vmsplice system call didnot properly perform verification of user-memory pointers. A localattacker could exploit this to overwrite arbitrary kernel memoryand gain root privileges. (CVE-2008-0600)

CVE-2008-0658.title: USN-584-1: OpenLDAP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0658.body: Jonathan Clarke discovered that the OpenLDAP slapd server did notproperly handle modify requests when using the Berkeley DB backendand specifying the NOOP control. An authenticated user with modifypermissions could send a crafted modify request and cause a denialof service via application crash. Ubuntu 7.10 is not affected bythis issue. (CVE-2007-6698)Ralf Haferkamp discovered that the OpenLDAP slapd server did notproperly handle modrdn requests when using the Berkeley DB backendand specifying the NOOP control. An authenticated user with modrdnpermissions could send a crafted modrdn request and possibly cause adenial of service via application crash. (CVE-2007-6698)

CVE-2008-0668.title: USN-604-1: Gnumeric vulnerability
CVE-2008-0668.body: Thilo Pfennig and Morten Welinder discovered that the XLS spreadsheethandling code in Gnumeric did not correctly calculate needed memory sizes.If a user or automated system were tricked into loading a specially craftedXLS document, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with userprivileges.

CVE-2008-0882.title: USN-598-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0882.body: It was discovered that CUPS had a flaw in its managing of remote sharedprinters via IPP. A remote attacker could send a crafted UDP packet andcause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code as thenon-root user in Ubuntu 6.06 LTS, 6.10, and 7.04. In Ubuntu 7.10,attackers would be isolated by the AppArmor CUPS profile. (CVE-2008-0882)

CVE-2008-0888.title: USN-589-1: unzip vulnerability
CVE-2008-0888.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that unzip did not correctly clean up pointers.If a user or automated service was tricked into processing a speciallycrafted ZIP archive, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code withuser privileges.

CVE-2008-0891.title: USN-620-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0891.body: It was discovered that OpenSSL was vulnerable to a double-freewhen using TLS server extensions. A remote attacker could send acrafted packet and cause a denial of service via application crashin applications linked against OpenSSL. Ubuntu 8.04 LTS does notcompile TLS server extensions by default. (CVE-2008-0891)

CVE-2008-0947.title: USN-587-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0947.body: A flaw was discovered in the kadmind service's handling of filedescriptors. An unauthenticated remote attacker could send speciallycrafted requests that would cause a crash, resulting in a denial ofservice. Only systems with configurations allowing large numbers ofopen file descriptors were vulnerable. (CVE-2008-0947)

CVE-2008-0960.title: USN-685-1: Net-SNMP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-0960.body: Wes Hardaker discovered that the SNMP service did not correctly validateHMAC authentication requests. An unauthenticated remote attackercould send specially crafted SNMPv3 traffic with a valid usernameand gain access to the user's views without a valid authenticationpassphrase. (CVE-2008-0960)

CVE-2008-1036.title: USN-747-1: ICU vulnerability
CVE-2008-1036.body: It was discovered that libicu did not correctly handle certain invalidencoded data. If a user or automated system were tricked into processingspecially crafted data with applications linked against libicu, certaincontent filters could be bypassed.

CVE-2008-1096.title: USN-681-1: ImageMagick vulnerability
CVE-2008-1096.body: It was discovered that ImageMagick did not correctly handle certainmalformed XCF images. If a user were tricked into opening a speciallycrafted image with an application that uses ImageMagick, an attackercould cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code withthe user's privileges.

CVE-2008-1105.title: USN-617-2: Samba regression
CVE-2008-1105.body: Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research discovered that Samba did not properly perform bounds checking when parsing SMB replies. A remote attacker could send crafted SMB packets and execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-1105)

CVE-2008-1105.title: USN-617-1: Samba vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1105.body: Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research discovered that Samba did notproperly perform bounds checking when parsing SMB replies. A remoteattacker could send crafted SMB packets and execute arbitrary code.(CVE-2008-1105)

CVE-2008-1108.title: USN-615-1: Evolution vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1108.body: Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research discovered that Evolution did notproperly validate timezone data when processing iCalendar attachments.If a user disabled the ITip Formatter plugin and viewed a craftediCalendar attachment, an attacker could cause a denial of service orpossibly execute code with user privileges. Note that the ITipFormatter plugin is enabled by default in Ubuntu. (CVE-2008-1108)

CVE-2008-1109.title: USN-615-1: Evolution vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1109.body: Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research discovered that Evolution did notproperly validate the DESCRIPTION field when processing iCalendarattachments. If a user were tricked into accepting a craftediCalendar attachment and replied to it from the calendar window, anattacker code cause a denial of service or execute code with userprivileges. (CVE-2008-1109)

CVE-2008-1110.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1110.body: It was discovered that the ASF demuxer in xine-lib did not properlycheck the length if the ASF header. If a user or automated systemwere tricked into opening a crafted ASF file, a remote attackercould cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary codewith the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2008-1110)

CVE-2008-1161.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1161.body: It was discovered that the Matroska demuxer in xine-lib did notproperly verify frame sizes. If xine-lib opened a crafted ASF file,a remote attacker could cause a denial of service or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. (CVE-2008-1161)

CVE-2008-1233.title: USN-592-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1233.body: Various flaws were discovered in the JavaScript engine. By trickinga user into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could escalateprivileges within the browser, perform cross-site scripting attacksand/or execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CVE-2008-1233, CVE-2008-1234, CVE-2008-1235)

CVE-2008-1233.title: USN-605-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1233.body: Various flaws were discovered in the JavaScript engine. If a user hadJavaScript enabled and were tricked into opening a malicious email,an attacker could escalate privileges within Thunderbird, performcross-site scripting attacks and/or execute arbitrary code with theuser's privileges. CVE-2008-1234.title: USN-605-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities

(CVE-2008-1233, CVE-2008-1234, CVE-2008-1235)

CVE-2008-1236.title: USN-592-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1236.body: Several problems were discovered in Firefox which could lead to crashesand memory corruption. If a user were tricked into opening a maliciousweb page, an attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code with theuser's privileges. (CVE-2008-1236, CVE-2008-1237)

CVE-2008-1236.title: USN-605-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1236.body: Several problems were discovered in Thunderbird which could lead tocrashes and memory corruption. If a user had JavaScript enabled andwere tricked into opening a malicious email, an attacker may be ableto execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-1236,CVE-2008-1237)

CVE-2008-1237.title: USN-592-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1237.body: Several problems were discovered in Firefox which could lead to crashesand memory corruption. If a user were tricked into opening a maliciousweb page, an attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code with theuser's privileges. (CVE-2008-1236, CVE-2008-1237)

CVE-2008-1237.title: USN-605-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1237.body: Several problems were discovered in Thunderbird which could lead tocrashes and memory corruption. If a user had JavaScript enabled andwere tricked into opening a malicious email, an attacker may be ableto execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-1236,CVE-2008-1237)

CVE-2008-1238.title: USN-592-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1238.body: Gregory Fleischer discovered Firefox did not properly process HTTPReferrer headers when they were sent with with requests to URLscontaining Basic Authentication credentials with empty usernames. Anattacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site requestforgery attacks. (CVE-2008-1238)

CVE-2008-1294.title: USN-618-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1294.body: It was discovered that CPU resource limits could be bypassed.A malicious local user could exploit this to avoid administrativelyimposed resource limits. (CVE-2008-1294)

CVE-2008-1373.title: USN-598-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1373.body: It was discovered that CUPS did not properly perform bounds checking inits GIF decoding routines. If a crafted GIF file were printed, an attackercould possibly execute arbitrary code as the non-root user in Ubuntu 6.06LTS, 6.10, and 7.04. In Ubuntu 7.10, attackers would be isolated by theAppArmor CUPS profile. (CVE-2008-1373)

CVE-2008-1377.title: USN-616-1: X.org vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1377.body: Multiple flaws were found in the RENDER, RECORD, and Securityextensions of X.org which did not correctly validate function arguments.An authenticated attacker could send specially crafted requests and gainroot privileges or crash X. (CVE-2008-1377, CVE-2008-2360, CVE-2008-2361,CVE-2008-2362)

CVE-2008-1379.title: USN-616-1: X.org vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1379.body: It was discovered that the MIT-SHM extension of X.org did not correctlyvalidate the location of memory during an image copy. An authenticatedattacker could exploit this to read arbitrary memory locations within X,exposing sensitive information. (CVE-2008-1379)

CVE-2008-1380.title: USN-602-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1380.body: Flaws were discovered in Firefox which could lead to crashes duringJavaScript garbage collection. If a user were tricked into opening amalicious web page, an attacker may be able to crash the browser orpossibly execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CVE-2008-1380)

CVE-2008-1384.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1384.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the php_sprintf_appendstringfunction. Attackers could exploit this to cause a denial of service.(CVE-2008-1384)

CVE-2008-1419.title: USN-682-1: libvorbis vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1419.body: It was discovered that libvorbis did not correctly handle certain malformedsound files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted soundfile with an application that uses libvorbis, an attacker could executearbitrary code with the user's privileges.

CVE-2008-1420.title: USN-682-1: libvorbis vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1420.body: It was discovered that libvorbis did not correctly handle certain malformedsound files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted soundfile with an application that uses libvorbis, an attacker could executearbitrary code with the user's privileges.

CVE-2008-1423.title: USN-682-1: libvorbis vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1423.body: It was discovered that libvorbis did not correctly handle certain malformedsound files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted soundfile with an application that uses libvorbis, an attacker could executearbitrary code with the user's privileges.

CVE-2008-1482.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1482.body: Luigi Auriemma discovered multiple integer overflows in xine-lib. Ifa user or automated system were tricked into opening a crafted FLV,MOV, RM, MVE, MKV or CAK file, a remote attacker may be able toexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2008-1482)

CVE-2008-1612.title: USN-601-1: Squid vulnerability
CVE-2008-1612.body: It was discovered that Squid did not perform proper bounds checking whenprocessing cache update replies. A remote authenticated user may be ableto trigger an assertion error and cause a denial of service. Thisvulnerability is due to an incorrect upstream fix for CVE-2007-6239.(CVE-2008-1612)

CVE-2008-1615.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1615.body: Jan Kratochvil discovered that PTRACE did not correctly handle certaincalls when running under 64bit kernels. A local attacker could exploit thisto crash the system, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-1615)

CVE-2008-1657.title: USN-649-1: OpenSSH vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1657.body: It was discovered that the ForceCommand directive could be bypassed.If a local user created a malicious ~/.ssh/rc file, they could executearbitrary commands as their user id. This only affected Ubuntu 7.10.(CVE-2008-1657)

CVE-2008-1669.title: USN-618-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1669.body: On SMP systems, a race condition existed in fcntl(). Local attackerscould perform malicious locks, causing system crashes and leading toa denial of service. (CVE-2008-1669)

CVE-2008-1672.title: USN-620-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1672.body: It was discovered that OpenSSL could dereference a NULL pointer.If a user or automated system were tricked into connecting to amalicious server with particular cipher suites, a remote attackercould cause a denial of service via application crash.(CVE-2008-1672)

CVE-2008-1673.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1673.body: Wei Wang discovered that the ASN.1 decoding routines in CIFS and SNMP NATdid not correctly handle certain length values. Remote attackers couldexploit this to execute arbitrary code or crash the system. (CVE-2008-1673)

CVE-2008-1678.title: USN-731-1: Apache vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1678.body: It was discovered that Apache had a memory leak when using mod_ssl withcompression. A remote attacker could exploit this to exhaust server memory,leading to a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 7.10.(CVE-2008-1678)

CVE-2008-1679.title: USN-632-1: Python vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1679.body: It was discovered that there were new integer overflows in the imageopmodule. If an attacker were able to trick a Python application intoprocessing a specially crafted image, they could execute arbitrary codewith user privileges. (CVE-2008-1679)

CVE-2008-1686.title: USN-611-1: Speex vulnerability
CVE-2008-1686.body: It was discovered that Speex did not properly validate its input whenprocessing Speex file headers. If a user or automated system weretricked into opening a specially crafted Speex file, an attacker couldcreate a denial of service in applications linked against Speex orpossibly execute arbitrary code as the user invoking the program.

CVE-2008-1693.title: USN-603-1: poppler vulnerability
CVE-2008-1693.body: It was discovered that the poppler PDF library did not correctly handlecertain malformed embedded fonts. If a user or an automated system weretricked into opening a malicious PDF, a remote attacker could executearbitrary code with user privileges.

CVE-2008-1693.title: USN-603-2: KOffice vulnerability

If a user or an automated system were tricked into opening a malicious PDF, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

CVE-2008-1721.title: USN-632-1: Python vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1721.body: Justin Ferguson discovered that the zlib module did not correctlyhandle certain archives. If an attacker were able to trick a Pythonapplication into processing a specially crafted archive file, they couldexecute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2008-1721)

CVE-2008-1722.title: USN-606-1: CUPS vulnerability
CVE-2008-1722.body: Thomas Pollet discovered that CUPS did not properly validate the size ofPNG images. A local attacker, and a remote attacker if printer sharingis enabled, could send a crafted file and cause a denial of service orpossibly execute arbitrary code as the non-root user in Ubuntu 6.06 LTSand 7.04. In Ubuntu 7.10, attackers would be isolated by the AppArmorCUPS profile. (CVE-2008-1722)

CVE-2008-1767.title: USN-633-1: libxslt vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1767.body: It was discovered that long transformation matches in libxslt couldoverflow. If an attacker were able to make an application linked againstlibxslt process malicious XSL style sheet input, they could executearbitrary code with user privileges or cause the application to crash,leading to a denial of serivce. (CVE-2008-1767)

CVE-2008-1801.title: USN-646-1: rdesktop vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1801.body: It was discovered that rdesktop did not properly validate the lengthof packet headers when processing RDP requests. If a user were trickedinto connecting to a malicious server, an attacker could cause adenial of service or possible execute arbitrary code with theprivileges of the user. (CVE-2008-1801)

CVE-2008-1802.title: USN-646-1: rdesktop vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1802.body: Multiple buffer overflows were discovered in rdesktop when processingRDP redirect requests. If a user were tricked into connecting to amalicious server, an attacker could cause a denial of service orpossible execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user.(CVE-2008-1802)

CVE-2008-1806.title: USN-643-1: FreeType vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1806.body: Multiple flaws were discovered in the PFB and TTF font handling codein freetype. If a user were tricked into using a specially craftedfont file, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with userprivileges or cause the application linked against freetype to crash,leading to a denial of service.

CVE-2008-1878.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1878.body: Guido Landi discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in xine-libwhen processing NSF files. CVE-2008-1887.title: USN-632-1: Python vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1887.body: Justin Ferguson discovered that certain string manipulations in Pythoncould be made to overflow. If an attacker were able to pass a speciallycrafted string through the PyString_FromStringAndSize function, theycould execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2008-1887)

CVE-2008-1927.title: USN-700-1: Perl vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1927.body: Tavis Ormandy and Will Drewry discovered that Perl did not correctlyhandle certain utf8 characters in regular expressions. If a user orautomated system were tricked into using a specially crafted expression,a remote attacker could crash the application, leading to a denialof service. Ubuntu 8.10 was not affected by this issue. (CVE-2008-1927)

CVE-2008-1927.title: USN-700-2: Perl regression
CVE-2008-1927.body: Tavis Ormandy and Will Drewry discovered that Perl did not correctly handle certain utf8 characters in regular expressions. If a user or automated system were tricked into using a specially crafted expression, a remote attacker could crash the application, leading to a denial of service. Ubuntu 8.10 was not affected by this issue. (CVE-2008-1927)

CVE-2008-1948.title: USN-613-1: GnuTLS vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1948.body: Multiple flaws were discovered in the connection handling of GnuTLS.A remote attacker could exploit this to crash applications linkedagainst GnuTLS, or possibly execute arbitrary code with permissions ofthe application's user.

CVE-2008-1949.title: USN-613-1: GnuTLS vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-1949.body: Multiple flaws were discovered in the connection handling of GnuTLS.A remote attacker could exploit this to crash applications linkedagainst GnuTLS, or possibly execute arbitrary code with permissions ofthe application's user.

CVE-2008-2004.title: USN-776-1: KVM vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2004.body: Avi Kivity discovered that KVM did not correctly handle certain diskformats. A local attacker could attach a malicious partition thatwould allow the guest VM to read files on the VM host. (CVE-2008-1945,CVE-2008-2004)

CVE-2008-2050.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2050.body: Andrei Nigmatulin discovered stack-based overflows in the FastCGI SAPIof PHP. An attacker may be able to leverage this issue to performattacks against PHP applications. (CVE-2008-2050)

CVE-2008-2079.title: USN-671-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2079.body: It was discovered that MySQL could be made to overwrite existing tablefiles in the data directory. An authenticated user could use theDATA DIRECTORY and INDEX DIRECTORY options to possibly bypass privilegechecks. This update alters table creation behaviour by disallowing theuse of the MySQL data directory in DATA DIRECTORY and INDEX DIRECTORYoptions. (CVE-2008-2079, CVE-2008-4097 and CVE-2008-4098)

CVE-2008-2107.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2107.body: It was discovered that the GENERATE_SEED macro produced a predictableseed under certain circumstances. Attackers may by able to easilypredict the results of the rand and mt_rand functions.(CVE-2008-2107, CVE-2008-2108)

CVE-2008-2108.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2108.body: It was discovered that the GENERATE_SEED macro produced a predictableseed under certain circumstances. Attackers may by able to easilypredict the results of the rand and mt_rand functions.(CVE-2008-2107, CVE-2008-2108)

CVE-2008-2136.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2136.body: Paul Marks discovered that the SIT interfaces did not correctly manageallocated memory. A remote attacker could exploit this to fill allavailable memory, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2136)

CVE-2008-2137.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2137.body: David Miller and Jan Lieskovsky discovered that the Sparc kernel did notcorrectly range-check memory regions allocated with mmap. A local attackercould exploit this to crash the system, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-2137)

CVE-2008-2148.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2148.body: The sys_utimensat system call did not correctly check file permissions incertain situations. A local attacker could exploit this to modify the filetimes of arbitrary files which could lead to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-2148)

CVE-2008-2168.title: USN-731-1: Apache vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2168.body: It was discovered that in certain conditions, Apache did not specify a defaultcharacter set when returning certain error messages containing UTF-7 encodeddata, which could result in browsers becoming vulnerable to cross-site scriptingattacks when processing the output. This issue only affected Ubuntu 6.06 LTS and7.10. (CVE-2008-2168)

CVE-2008-2237.title: USN-677-2: OpenOffice.org Internationalization update
CVE-2008-2237.body: Multiple memory overflow flaws were discovered in OpenOffice.org's handling of WMF and EMF files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, a remote attacker might be able to execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2008-2237, CVE-2008-2238)

CVE-2008-2237.title: USN-677-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities

CVE-2008-2238.title: USN-677-2: OpenOffice.org Internationalization update

CVE-2008-2238.title: USN-677-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2238.body: Multiple memory overflow flaws were discovered in OpenOffice.org's handling ofWMF and EMF files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafteddocument, a remote attacker might be able to execute arbitrary code with userprivileges. (CVE-2008-2237, CVE-2008-2238)

CVE-2008-2285.title: USN-612-5: OpenSSH update
CVE-2008-2285.body: Matt Zimmerman discovered that entries in ~/.ssh/authorized_keyswith options (such as "no-port-forwarding" or forced commands) wereignored by the new ssh-vulnkey tool introduced in OpenSSH (seeUSN-612-2). This could cause some compromised keys not to belisted in ssh-vulnkey's output.This update also adds more information to ssh-vulnkey's manual page.Original advisory details:A weakness has been discovered in the random number generator used by OpenSSL on Debian and Ubuntu systems. As a result of this weakness, certain encryption keys are much more common than they should be, such that an attacker could guess the key through a brute-force attack given minimal knowledge of the system. This particularly affects the use of encryption keys in OpenSSH, OpenVPN and SSL certificates.

CVE-2008-2292.title: USN-685-1: Net-SNMP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2292.body: John Kortink discovered that the Net-SNMP Perl module did not correctlycheck the size of returned values. If a user or automated system weretricked into querying a malicious SNMP server, the application usingthe Perl module could be made to crash, leading to a denial of service.This did not affect Ubuntu 8.10. (CVE-2008-2292)

CVE-2008-2315.title: USN-632-1: Python vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2315.body: Multiple integer overflows were discovered in Python's core and modulesincluding hashlib, binascii, pickle, md5, stringobject, unicodeobject,bufferobject, longobject, tupleobject, stropmodule, gcmodule, andmmapmodule. If an attacker were able to exploit these flaws they couldexecute arbitrary code with user privileges or cause Python applicationsto crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2315, CVE-2008-2316,CVE-2008-3142, CVE-2008-3143, CVE-2008-3144).

CVE-2008-2316.title: USN-632-1: Python vulnerabilities

If a user or automated system were tricked intoprocessing a malicious image, a remote attacker could execute arbitrarycode or cause an application linked against libtiff to crash, leadingto a denial of service.

CVE-2008-2358.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2358.body: Brandon Edwards discovered that the DCCP system in the kernel did notcorrectly check feature lengths. A remote attacker could exploit this toexecute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-2358)

CVE-2008-2360.title: USN-616-1: X.org vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2360.body: Multiple flaws were found in the RENDER, RECORD, and Securityextensions of X.org which did not correctly validate function arguments.An authenticated attacker could send specially crafted requests and gainroot privileges or crash X. CVE-2008-2364.title: USN-731-1: Apache vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2364.body: It was discovered that when configured as a proxy server, Apache did not limitthe number of forwarded interim responses. A malicious remote server could senda large number of interim responses and cause a denial of service via memoryexhaustion. (CVE-2008-2364)

CVE-2008-2371.title: USN-624-1: PCRE vulnerability
CVE-2008-2371.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the PCRE library did not correctly handlecertain in-pattern options. An attacker could cause applications linkedagainst pcre3 to crash, leading to a denial of service.

CVE-2008-2371.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2371.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the PCRE library did not correctlyhandle certain in-pattern options. An attacker could cause PHPapplications using pcre to crash, leading to a denial of service.USN-624-1 fixed vulnerabilities in the pcre3 library. This updateprovides the corresponding update for PHP. (CVE-2008-2371)

CVE-2008-2371.title: USN-624-2: Erlang vulnerability

CVE-2008-2372.body: It was discovered that the disabling of the ZERO_PAGE optimization couldlead to large memory consumption. A local attacker could exploit this toallocate all available memory, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-2372)

CVE-2008-2426.body: It was discovered that Imlib2 did not correctly handle certain malformed XPMand PNG images. (CVE-2008-2785)

If a user were tricked into openinga malicious web page, an attacker could cause a denial of service orpossibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. (CVE-2008-2785)

CVE-2008-2798.body: Various flaws were discovered in the browser engine. By trickinga user into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could causea denial of service via application crash, or possibly executearbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2008-2798, CVE-2008-2799)

(CVE-2008-2798, CVE-2008-2799)

CVE-2008-2800.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2800.body: Several problems were discovered in the JavaScript engine. If auser were tricked into opening a malicious web page, an attackercould perform cross-site scripting attacks. (CVE-2008-2800)

CVE-2008-2801.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2801.body: Collin Jackson discovered various flaws in the JavaScript enginewhich allowed JavaScript to be injected into signed JAR files. Ifa user were tricked into opening malicious web content, anattacker may be able to execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof a different website or link content within the JAR file to anattacker-controlled JavaScript file. (CVE-2008-2801)

CVE-2008-2802.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2802.body: It was discovered that Firefox would allow non-privileged XULdocuments to load chrome scripts from the fastload file. Thiscould allow an attacker to execute arbitrary JavaScript code withchrome privileges. (CVE-2008-2802)

CVE-2008-2802.title: USN-629-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2802.body: It was discovered that Thunderbird would allow non-privileged XULdocuments to load chrome scripts from the fastload file if Javascriptwas enabled. This could allow an attacker to execute arbitraryJavascript code with chrome privileges. (CVE-2008-2802)

CVE-2008-2803.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2803.body: A flaw was discovered in Firefox that allowed overwriting trustedobjects via mozIJSSubScriptLoader.loadSubScript(). If a user weretricked into opening a malicious web page, an attacker couldexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2008-2803)

CVE-2008-2803.title: USN-629-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2803.body: A flaw was discovered in Thunderbird that allowed overwriting trustedobjects via mozIJSSubScriptLoader.loadSubScript(). If a user hadJavascript enabled and was tricked into opening a malicious web page,an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of theuser invoking the program. (CVE-2008-2803)

CVE-2008-2805.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2805.body: Claudio Santambrogio discovered a vulnerability in Firefox whichcould lead to stealing of arbitrary files. If a user were trickedinto opening malicious content, an attacker could force the browserinto uploading local files to the remote server. (CVE-2008-2805)

CVE-2008-2806.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2806.body: Gregory Fleischer discovered a flaw in Java LiveConnect. An attackercould exploit this to bypass the same-origin policy and createarbitrary socket connections to other domains. (CVE-2008-2806)

CVE-2008-2807.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2807.body: Daniel Glazman found that an improperly encoded .properties filein an add-on can result in uninitialized memory being used. Ifa user were tricked into installing a malicious add-on, thebrowser may be able to see data from other programs.(CVE-2008-2807)

CVE-2008-2807.title: USN-629-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2807.body: Daniel Glazman found that an improperly encoded .properties file inan add-on can result in uninitialized memory being used. If a userwere tricked into installing a malicious add-on, Thunderbird may beable to see data from other programs. (CVE-2008-2807)

CVE-2008-2808.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2808.body: Masahiro Yamada discovered that Firefox did not properly sanitizefile URLs in directory listings, resulting in files from directorylistings being opened in unintended ways or not being able to beopened by the browser at all. (CVE-2008-2808)

CVE-2008-2809.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2809.body: John G. Myers discovered a weakness in the trust model used byFirefox regarding alternate names on self-signed certificates. Ifa user were tricked into accepting a certificate containingalternate name entries, an attacker could impersonate anotherserver. (CVE-2008-2809)

CVE-2008-2809.title: USN-629-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2809.body: John G. Myers discovered a weakness in the trust model used byThunderbird regarding alternate names on self-signed certificates.If a user were tricked into accepting a certificate containingalternate name entries, an attacker could impersonate anotherserver. (CVE-2008-2809)

CVE-2008-2810.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2810.body: A flaw was discovered in the way Firefox opened URL files. If a userwere tricked into opening a bookmark to a malicious web page, thepage could potentially read from local files on the user's computer.(CVE-2008-2810)

CVE-2008-2811.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2811.body: A vulnerability was discovered in the block reflow code of Firefox.This vulnerability could be used by an attacker to cause a denial ofservice via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with theprivileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2008-2811)

CVE-2008-2811.title: USN-629-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2811.body: A vulnerability was discovered in the block reflow code ofThunderbird. If a user enabled Javascript, this vulnerability couldbe used by an attacker to cause a denial of service via applicationcrash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2008-2811)

CVE-2008-2826.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2826.body: Gabriel Campana discovered that SCTP routines did not correctly check forlarge addresses. A local user could exploit this to allocate all availablememory, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2826)

CVE-2008-2829.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2829.body: It was discovered that php_imap used obsolete API calls. If a PHPapplication were tricked into processing a malicious IMAP request,an attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute codewith application privileges. (CVE-2008-2829)

CVE-2008-2927.title: USN-675-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2927.body: It was discovered that Pidgin did not properly handle certain malformedmessages in the MSN protocol handler. A remote attacker could send a speciallycrafted message and possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.(CVE-2008-2927)

CVE-2008-2927.title: USN-675-2: Gaim vulnerability
CVE-2008-2927.body: It was discovered that Gaim did not properly handle certain malformedmessages in the MSN protocol handler. A remote attacker could send a speciallycrafted message and possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.(CVE-2008-2927)

CVE-2008-2933.title: USN-626-2: Devhelp, Epiphany, Midbrowser and Yelp update
CVE-2008-2933.body: Billy Rios discovered that Firefox and xulrunner, as used by browsers such as Epiphany, did not properly perform URI splitting with pipe symbols when passed a command-line URI. If Firefox or xulrunner were passed a malicious URL, an attacker may be able to execute local content with chrome privileges. (CVE-2008-2933)

CVE-2008-2933.title: USN-623-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2933.body: Billy Rios discovered that Firefox did not properly perform URI splittingwith pipe symbols when passed a command-line URI. If Firefox were passeda malicious URL, an attacker may be able to execute local content withchrome privileges. (CVE-2008-2933)

CVE-2008-2935.title: USN-633-1: libxslt vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2935.body: Chris Evans discovered that the RC4 processing code in libxslt did notcorrectly handle corrupted key information. If a remote attacker wereable to make an application linked against libxslt process maliciousXML input, they could crash the application, leading to a denial ofservice. (CVE-2008-2935)

CVE-2008-2939.title: USN-731-1: Apache vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2939.body: It was discovered that mod_proxy_ftp did not sanitize wildcard pathnames whenthey are returned in directory listings, which could result in browsers becomingvulnerable to cross-site scripting attacks when processing the output.(CVE-2008-2939)

CVE-2008-2940.title: USN-674-1: HPLIP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2940.body: It was discovered that the hpssd tool of hplip did not validateprivileges in the alert-mailing function. A local attacker couldexploit this to gain privileges and send e-mail messages from theaccount of the hplip user. This update alters hplip behaviour bypreventing users from setting alerts and by moving alert configurationto a root-controlled /etc/hp/alerts.conf file. (CVE-2008-2940)

CVE-2008-2940.title: USN-674-2: HPLIP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2940.body: It was discovered that the hpssd tool of hplip did not validate privileges in the alert-mailing function. A local attacker could exploit this to gain privileges and send e-mail messages from the account of the hplip user. This update alters hplip behaviour by preventing users from setting alerts and by moving alert configuration to a root-controlled /etc/hp/alerts.conf file. (CVE-2008-2940)

CVE-2008-2941.title: USN-674-1: HPLIP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2941.body: It was discovered that the hpssd tool of hplip did not correctlyhandle certain commands. A local attacker could use a speciallycrafted packet to crash hpssd, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-2941)

CVE-2008-2941.title: USN-674-2: HPLIP vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2941.body: It was discovered that the hpssd tool of hplip did not correctly handle certain commands. A local attacker could use a specially crafted packet to crash hpssd, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2941)

CVE-2008-2950.title: USN-631-1: poppler vulnerability
CVE-2008-2950.body: Felipe Andres Manzano discovered that poppler did not correctly initializecertain page widgets. If a user were tricked into viewing a maliciousPDF file, a remote attacker could exploit this to crash applicationslinked against poppler, leading to a denial of service.

CVE-2008-2952.title: USN-634-1: OpenLDAP vulnerability
CVE-2008-2952.body: Cameron Hotchkies discovered that OpenLDAP did not correctly handlecertain ASN.1 BER data. A remote attacker could send a specially craftedpacket and crash slapd, leading to a denial of service.

CVE-2008-2955.title: USN-675-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2955.body: It was discovered that Pidgin did not properly handle file transfers containinga long filename and special characters in the MSN protocol handler. A remoteattacker could send a specially crafted filename in a file transfer requestand cause Pidgin to crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2955)

CVE-2008-2957.title: USN-675-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-2957.body: It was discovered that Pidgin did not impose resource limitations in the UPnPservice. A remote attacker could cause Pidgin to download arbitrary filesand cause a denial of service from memory or disk space exhaustion.(CVE-2008-2957)

CVE-2008-3142.title: USN-632-1: Python vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3142.body: Multiple integer overflows were discovered in Python's core and modulesincluding hashlib, binascii, pickle, md5, stringobject, unicodeobject,bufferobject, longobject, tupleobject, stropmodule, gcmodule, andmmapmodule. If an attacker were able to exploit these flaws they couldexecute arbitrary code with user privileges or cause Python applicationsto crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2315, CVE-2008-2316,CVE-2008-3142, CVE-2008-3143, CVE-2008-3144).

CVE-2008-3143.title: USN-632-1: Python vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3143.body: Multiple integer overflows were discovered in Python's core and modulesincluding hashlib, binascii, pickle, md5, stringobject, unicodeobject,bufferobject, longobject, tupleobject, stropmodule, gcmodule, andmmapmodule. If an attacker were able to exploit these flaws they couldexecute arbitrary code with user privileges or cause Python applicationsto crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2315, CVE-2008-2316,CVE-2008-3142, CVE-2008-3143, CVE-2008-3144).

CVE-2008-3144.title: USN-632-1: Python vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3144.body: Multiple integer overflows were discovered in Python's core and modulesincluding hashlib, binascii, pickle, md5, stringobject, unicodeobject,bufferobject, longobject, tupleobject, stropmodule, gcmodule, andmmapmodule. If an attacker were able to exploit these flaws they couldexecute arbitrary code with user privileges or cause Python applicationsto crash, leading to a denial of service. CVE-2008-3162.title: USN-630-1: ffmpeg vulnerability
CVE-2008-3162.body: It was discovered that ffmpeg did not correctly handle STR filedemuxing. If a user were tricked into processing a malicious STR file,a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with user privileges viaapplications linked against ffmpeg.

CVE-2008-3276.title: USN-659-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3276.body: It was discovered that the Datagram Congestion Control Protocol (DCCP) didnot correctly validate its arguments. If DCCP was in use, a remote attackercould send specially crafted network traffic and cause a system crash,leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-3276)

CVE-2008-3281.title: USN-640-1: libxml2 vulnerability
CVE-2008-3281.body: Andreas Solberg discovered that libxml2 did not handle recursive entitiessafely. If an application linked against libxml2 were made to processa specially crafted XML document, a remote attacker could exhaust thesystem's CPU resources, leading to a denial of service.

CVE-2008-3520.title: USN-742-1: JasPer vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3520.body: It was discovered that JasPer did not correctly handle memory allocationwhen parsing certain malformed JPEG2000 images. If a user were tricked intoopening a specially crafted image with an application that uses libjasper,an attacker could cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrarycode with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-3520)

CVE-2008-3522.title: USN-742-1: JasPer vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3522.body: It was discovered that JasPer did not correctly handle certain formattingoperations. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted imagewith an application that uses libjasper, an attacker could cause a denialof service and possibly execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CVE-2008-3522)

CVE-2008-3525.title: USN-659-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3525.body: It was discovered that the SBNI WAN driver did not correctly check for theNET_ADMIN capability. A malicious local root user lacking CAP_NET_ADMINwould be able to change the WAN device configuration, leading to a denialof service. (CVE-2008-3525)

CVE-2008-3526.title: USN-659-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3526.body: It was discovered that the Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) didnot correctly validate the key length in the SCTP_AUTH_KEY option. If SCTPis in use, a remote attacker could send specially crafted network trafficthat would crash the system, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-3526)

CVE-2008-3528.title: USN-662-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3528.body: It was discovered that the Linux kernel could be made to hang temporarilywhen mounting corrupted ext2/3 filesystems. If a user were tricked intomounting a specially crafted filesystem, a remote attacker could causesystem hangs, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-3528)

CVE-2008-3529.title: USN-815-1: libxml2 vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3529.body: It was discovered that libxml2 did not correctly handle long entity names. If a user were tricked into processing a specially crafted XML document, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with user privileges or cause the application linked against libxml2 to crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-3529)

CVE-2008-3532.title: USN-675-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3532.body: It was discovered that Pidgin did not validate SSL certificates when using asecure connection. If a remote attacker were able to perform aman-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to view sensitiveinformation. This update alters Pidgin behaviour by asking users to confirmthe validity of a certificate upon initial login. (CVE-2008-3532)

CVE-2008-3546.title: USN-723-1: Git vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3546.body: It was discovered that Git did not properly handle long file paths. If a userwere tricked into performing commands on a specially crafted Git repository, anattacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2008-3546)

CVE-2008-3632.title: USN-676-1: WebKit vulnerability
CVE-2008-3632.body: It was discovered that WebKit did not properly handle Cascading Style Sheets(CSS) import statements. If a user were tricked into opening a maliciouswebsite, an attacker could cause a browser crash and possibly executearbitrary code with user privileges.

CVE-2008-3651.title: USN-641-1: Racoon vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3651.body: It was discovered that there were multiple ways to leak memory during theIKE negotiation when handling certain packets. If a remoteattacker sent repeated malicious requests, the "racoon" key exchangeserver could allocate large amounts of memory, possibly leading to adenial of service.

CVE-2008-3652.title: USN-641-1: Racoon vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3652.body: It was discovered that there were multiple ways to leak memory during theIKE negotiation when handling certain packets. If a remoteattacker sent repeated malicious requests, the "racoon" key exchangeserver could allocate large amounts of memory, possibly leading to adenial of service.

CVE-2008-3714.title: USN-686-1: AWStats vulnerability
CVE-2008-3714.body: Morgan Todd discovered that AWStats did not correctly strip quotes fromcertain parameters, allowing for an XSS attack when running as a CGI.If a user was tricked by a remote attacker into following a speciallycrafted URL, the user's authentication information could be exposed forthe domain where AWStats was hosted.

CVE-2008-3831.title: USN-659-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3831.body: It was discovered the the i915 video driver did not correctly validatememory addresses. A local attacker could exploit this to remap memorythat could cause a system crash, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-3831)

CVE-2008-3831.title: USN-679-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3831.body: It was discovered the the i915 video driver did not correctly validatememory addresses. A local attacker could exploit this to remap memory thatcould cause a system crash, leading to a denial of service. This issue didnot affect Ubuntu 6.06 and was previous fixed for Ubuntu 7.10 and 8.04 inUSN-659-1. Ubuntu 8.10 has now been corrected as well. (CVE-2008-3831)

CVE-2008-3834.title: USN-653-1: D-Bus vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3834.body: It was discovered that the D-Bus library did not correctly validatecertain corrupted signatures. If a local user sent a specially craftedD-Bus request, they could crash applications linked against the D-Buslibrary, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-3834)

CVE-2008-3835.title: USN-647-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3835.body: It was discovered that the same-origin check in Thunderbird couldbe bypassed. If a user had JavaScript enabled and were tricked intoopening a malicious website, an attacker may be able to executeJavaScript in the context of a different website. (CVE-2008-3835)

CVE-2008-3835.title: USN-645-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3835.body: It was discovered that the same-origin check in Firefox could bebypassed. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious website,an attacker may be able to execute JavaScript in the context of adifferent website. (CVE-2008-3835)

CVE-2008-3835.title: USN-645-2: Firefox vulnerabilities

CVE-2008-3836.title: USN-645-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3836.body: Several problems were discovered in the JavaScript engine. Thiscould allow an attacker to execute scripts from page content withchrome privileges. (CVE-2008-3836)

CVE-2008-3836.title: USN-645-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3836.body: Several problems were discovered in the JavaScript engine. This could allow an attacker to execute scripts from page content with chrome privileges. (CVE-2008-3836)

CVE-2008-3863.title: USN-660-1: enscript vulnerability
CVE-2008-3863.body: Ulf Härnhammar discovered multiple stack overflows in enscript's handling ofspecial escape arguments. If a user or automated system were tricked intoprocessing a malicious file with the "-e" option enabled, a remote attackercould execute arbitrary code or cause enscript to crash, possibly leadingto a denial of service.

CVE-2008-3889.title: USN-642-1: Postfix vulnerability
CVE-2008-3889.body: Wietse Venema discovered that Postfix leaked internal file descriptorswhen executing non-Postfix commands. A local attacker could exploitthis to cause Postfix to run out of descriptors, leading to a denialof service.

CVE-2008-3915.title: USN-659-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2008-3915.body: Johann Dahm and David Richter discovered that NFSv4 did not correctlyhandle certain file ACLs. If NFSv4 is in use, a local attacker could createa malicious ACL that could cause a system crash, leading to a denial ofservice. (CVE-2008-3915)

If a user were tricked into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2008-4061, CVE-2008-4062, CVE-2008-4063, CVE-2008-4064)

(CVE-2008-4061, CVE-2008-4062,CVE-2008-4063, CVE-2008-4064)

If a user hadJavaScript enabled and were tricked into opening a malicious webpage, an attacker could cause a denial of service or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram.
